00036 
00037 canonLine::canonLine(std::string canonL, machineStatus prevStatus): status(prevStatus) {
00038   myLine = canonL;
00039   tokenize(); //splits myLine using delimiters
00040 }
00041 
00043 int canonLine::getN() {
00044   if ( (canonTokens[1].c_str()[1] == '.') && (canonTokens[1].c_str()[2] == '.') )
00045     return -1;
00046   else
00047     return tok2i(1,1);
00048 }
00049 
00051 int canonLine::getLineNum() {
00052   return tok2i(0);
00053 }
00054 
00056 const machineStatus* canonLine::getStatus() {
00057   return &status;
00058 }

00068 inline double canonLine::tok2d(uint n) {
00069   char * end;
00070   double d = strtod( canonTokens[n].c_str(), &end );
00071   assert ( *end == 0 );
00072   return d;
00073 }
00074 
00076 inline int canonLine::tok2i(uint n,uint offset) {
00077   char * end;
00078   int i = strtol( &canonTokens[n].c_str()[offset], &end, 10 );
00079   assert ( *end == 0 );
00080   return i;
00081 }
00082 
00083 const std::string canonLine::getCanonicalCommand() {
00084   return canonTokens[2];
00085 }
00086 
00087 //from http://oopweb.com/CPP/Documents/CPPHOWTO/Volume/C++Programming-HOWTO-7.html
00088 //0 is canon line
00089 //1 is gcode Nnnnnn line
00090 //2 is canonical command
00093 void canonLine::tokenize(std::string str,
00094                          std::vector<std::string>& tokenV,
00095                          const std::string& delimiters) {
00096   // Skip delimiters at beginning.
00097   std::string::size_type lastPos = str.find_first_not_of(delimiters, 0);
00098   // Find first "non-delimiter".
00099   std::string::size_type pos     = str.find_first_of(delimiters, lastPos);
00100 
00101   while (std::string::npos != pos || std::string::npos != lastPos)
00102   {
00103     // Found a token, add it to the vector.
00104     tokenV.push_back(str.substr(lastPos, pos - lastPos));
00105     // Skip delimiters.  Note the "not_of"
00106     lastPos = str.find_first_not_of(delimiters, pos);
00107     // Find next "non-delimiter"
00108     pos = str.find_first_of(delimiters, lastPos);
00109   }
00110 }
00111 
00113 inline void canonLine::tokenize() {
00114   tokenize(myLine,canonTokens);
00115 }
00116 
00118 inline bool canonLine::clMatch(std::string m) {
00119   return (m.compare(canonTokens[2]) == 0); //compare returns zero for a match
00120 }
00121 
00127 canonLine * canonLine::canonLineFactory (std::string l, machineStatus s) {
00128   //check if canonical command is motion or something else
00129   //motion commands: STRAIGHT_TRAVERSE STRAIGHT_FEED ARC_FEED
00130   size_t lin,af,cmnt,msg;
00131   cmnt=l.find("COMMENT");
00132   msg=l.find("MESSAGE");
00133   lin=l.find("STRAIGHT_");
00134   af=l.find("ARC_FEED");
00135   /*
00136   ** check for comments first because it is not impossible
00137   ** for one to contain the text "LINEAR_" or "ARC_FEED"
00138   */
00139   if ( (cmnt!=std::string::npos) || (msg!=std::string::npos) ) {
00140     return new canonMotionless(l,s);
00141   } else if (lin!=std::string::npos) { //linear traverse or linear feed
00142     return new linearMotion(l,s);
00143   } else if (af!=std::string::npos) { //arc feed
00144     return new helicalMotion(l,s); //arc or helix
00145   } else { //canonical command is not a motion command
00146     return new canonMotionless(l,s);
00147   }
00148 }
